summary: The diff implements all five requirements with good fidelity. REQ-1 (Home wallet card), REQ-2 (Profile wallet card), REQ-3 (WalletQRModal with client-side QR), REQ-4 (walletBalance in backend), and REQ-5 (walletBalance exposed via useQueries) are all present. The QR code is generated via a custom pure-TypeScript library rather than qrcode.react, which still satisfies the client-side constraint. A ScanPayModal is integrated for the Send action which was not requested. A migration module was added as a bonus.

hallucinated_features.description: ScanPayModal integrated into FinMateWalletCard for the Send action button
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request lists actual fund transfers as a non-goal and only requests Send/Receive quick-action buttons. A full ScanPayModal with QR scanner and phone-number payment entry was wired to the Send button without being requested.
